peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is Towle a good brand?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: One of America's oldest, most respected brands, the Towle Silversmiths name dates back to a small colonial silversmith in 1690 Massachusetts. Since then, Towle sterling silver, silver-plated and stainless steel products have been appreciated across the country for their beauty and extraordinary quality.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Towle - Lifetime Brands

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the value of sterling silver flatware?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: How Much is Sterling Silver Worth? Sterling silverware may be worth as much as $5-$30+ per item, depending on the weight, condition, and purity. Most of the time when you sell sterling silver flatware, it will be sold to a refiner and melted down into pure silver.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Is Sterling Silver Flatware Valuable? Here's How to Tell!

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Where is Towle sterling silver made?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Towle Silversmiths is an American silver manufacturer. Towle Silversmiths was founded in 1690 by William Moulton II, the first silversmith in Newbury, Mass.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Towle Silversmiths - Wikipedia
